column4: anyone know how to switch monitors once ubuntu is loaded on a laptop?
I've always done that through the laptop Fn key
If I do that I get a big static image on the screen. I can only switch properly during booting
please give more specific error messages and we can try to give you some help
try running: killall wineserver && killall wine
I can easily close wine, but I get the same problem if I try again... I'll give killall wineserver though
killall doesn't output anythign by default
yeah, if the debugger loads, wine crashed
what program are you trying to run?
wine sets all that up automatically, in order to use wine you have to run it with a windows exe
I was following this howto: http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=149585
are you running the internet explorer installer?
I don't use winetools so I don't know what to tell you
how did YOU get wine to work?
it sets itself
I install it via apt, then run wine something.exe
yeah
winetools is for getting funky apps like IE to work
but I have no desire to have IE anywhere near my machine
do you need IE for anything other than running said browser?
I don't think so
man mplayer, search for dumpaudio
thanks
